answers.text:
Hi Erin, 
On the Knowledge Network we have a few resources that related to this topic that I hope you find useful. 
If you are interested in getting your community members involved here is a previously asked question that may help you : http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/kn/Question/21010/Citizen_Engagement__Participation_in_the_Website_Redesign_Process
Here is a website redesign RFP from the Town of Blacksburg, VA http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14351/RFP_Website_Redesign
You can also check out the City of Williamsburg's website we they have won awards for it including being a Silver Award Winner in the 2009 iNOVA Awards for Excellence in Corporate Websites:http://icma.org/en/Article/100089/Williamsburg_VA_Website_Wins_International_Award_for_Excellence
I hope that although these are not surveys they are still able to help you as you begin the redesign process. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Erin Bryce
text:
The City of North Port, Florida is about to embark on a website redesign and wanted to release a survey to the public to find out what is working and not working on the City's existing website. The City also hopes to see if the public had any ideas of how to improve the website.
Do you have any examples of similar surveys that your agency has released? If so, please provide the questions that you used.
title: Website Redesign Survey
